meta.content: Governor Pritzker has extended the stay at home order for the remainder of this school year. Schools will continue remote learning during the stay at home order. ​ Please pick up new packets at...

font.font:
Governor Pritzker has extended the stay at home order for the remainder of this school year. Schools will continue remote learning during the stay at home order.
​

font.u: Please pick up new packets at LaSalle and Parkview on Monday, April 20th between 8am and 12pm.

br.font: ​Please return the completed packets at this time.

strong.font: Also, please return any Library Books that have been checked out.
Students who have textbooks at home should also return the textbooks on this day.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the playgrounds at LaSalle Elementary and Parkview School are temporarily closed unitl further notice. This step is being done in an effort to comply with CDC Requirments and to prevent the transmission of the COVID-19 Virus.

font.span: Students who purchased Parkview Yearbooks can pick up the Yearbooks on Monday, April 20th at Parkview School at the Groveland Street Parent Pick Up Entrance. Additional Yearbooks can be purchased at a cost of $ 16. Additional Yearbooks can be purchased by contacting Ms. Melissant (

font.br: ​​Drive Through Meal Service will continue to be offered at both, LaSalle & Parkview Schools, between 10:00-11:00 AM

div.span: Please communicate with your child's school (LaSalle - 698-3605 / Parkview - 698-3610) if you are interested in receiving a breakfast / lunch but are not able to pick up the breakfast / lunch at your child's school.

font.a: Creve Coeur District 76 Remote Learning Plan

font.strong: Please know that you are not alone.

span.font: Heart of Illinois HelpLine for Community Resources:
Trevor Project – Saving Young LGBTQ Lives:

div.br: Creve Coeur District 76 staff drove through Creve Coeur letting the students know how much they are missed.

br.em:
(as of 2/24/20)
​Bus 3 is absorbed into Bus 1, 2, & 4 routes

td.div:
Welcome to the Creve Coeur School District, comprised of two amazing schools: LaSalle Elementary and Parkview Junior High.
We are here to encourage, challenge and celebrate your students.
Thank you to our teachers and support staff who want to see your child succeed and enjoy the adventure of learning.
We sincerely appreciate our school board members who devote countless hours striving to make this district the best it can be.
Our fine building principals are leaders who stand ready to help, providing a friendly atmosphere where your child is nurtured by caring faculty and support staff.
We are striving to make your child's educational experience one filled with great accomplishments, fun and friendships.
Together, we can achieve wonderful things.
My door is open. Stop by anytime.
​We're excited about the promise of another year of educational advancement and all the possibilities it can bring.
Yours in education,
Tony Whiston
​Superintendent

font.a: Speech, O/T, & P/T Activities for Home

td.div:
April 10th & 13th- No School; Easter Holiday
May 21st- 8th grade graduation at East Peoria High School at 6:30 p.m.
May 25th- No School; Memorial Day
May 28th- Last Day of School
Substitute pay is $100 per day, after 10 days pay is $115 per day.

font.a:
Tazewell County Health Dept.
​Back to School Brochure

td.div:
Medical Files –Requirements for 2019-2020 school year. All children entering school at any grade level (kindergarten through 12) shall show proof of having received two doses of live rubella and mumps virus vaccine. (MMR) Students entering Kindergarten, 6th or 9th grade for the first time shall show proof of having received two doses of varicella vaccine or other proof of immunity shall be submitted. The proof must come from the physician. Any child entering a school program below the kindergarten level shall show proof of immunization that complies with the pneumococcal conjugate vaccine. Remember also that all students entering kindergarten, 6th, and 9th grade must have a physical. Dental examinations are required for students entering kindergarten, 2nd, and 6th grade. Sixth graders must show proof of the Tdap immunization. An eye examination is required by the State for children entering kindergarten and new students to the state.
Please get your school and sports physical as soon as possible.
